hints.title: Composition of LSI Operators (Reference)
hints.content:
4072: :label: thm-composition-reference
4073: 
4074: If $\Psi_1$ and $\Psi_2$ are Markov operators on $\mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ satisfying:
4075: 
4076: 1. $D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_1 \# \mu \| \pi) \leq (1 - \alpha_1 \tau) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_1$
4077: 2. $D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_2 \# \nu \| \pi) \leq (1 - \alpha_2 \tau) D_{\text{KL}}(\nu \| \pi) + C_2$
4078: 
4079: Then the composition $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_2 \circ \Psi_1$ satisfies:
4080: 
4081: $$
4082: D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_{\text{total}} \# \mu \| \pi) \leq [1 - \tau(\alpha_1 + \alpha_2)] D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_1 + C_2 + O(\tau^2)
4083: $$
4084: 
4085: **Proof**: See {prf:ref}`thm-main-lsi-composition` of this document.

4069: ## Step 3: Composition via Existing Theorem

4071: :::{prf:theorem} Composition of LSI Operators (Reference)
4072: :label: thm-composition-reference
4073: 
4074: If $\Psi_1$ and $\Psi_2$ are Markov operators on $\mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ satisfying:
4075: 
4076: 1. $D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_1 \# \mu \| \pi) \leq (1 - \alpha_1 \tau) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_1$
4077: 2. $D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_2 \# \nu \| \pi) \leq (1 - \alpha_2 \tau) D_{\text{KL}}(\nu \| \pi) + C_2$
4078: 
4079: Then the composition $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_2 \circ \Psi_1$ satisfies:
4080: 
4081: $$
4082: D_{\text{KL}}(\Psi_{\text{total}} \# \mu \| \pi) \leq [1 - \tau(\alpha_1 + \alpha_2)] D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi) + C_1 + C_2 + O(\tau^2)
4083: $$
4084: 
4085: **Proof**: See {prf:ref}`thm-main-lsi-composition` of this document.
